question: Looking at the US population map, which statement below is the most accurate?

options.A: The population between Texas and California are similar.
options.B: The population gap between California and Texas might exceeds that between Texas and Florida.
options.C: The three states (Texas, California, Florida) have very diverse population levels.
options.D: The population differences are impossible to determine from this visualization.

explanation: California (39.5M) and Texas (30.1M) have a 9.4M population difference, while Texas (30.1M) and Florida (27.5M) have only a 2.6M difference. However, the categorical color encoding groups California and Texas into the same color bin (30M+ range), making their large difference appear similar, while Texas and Florida appear more different due to different color bins.
